alert.note: Alert for Blanco; Kendall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 10:47PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Blanco and northeastern Kendall Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1046 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Albert, or 14 miles southeast of Fredericksburg, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blanco, Sisterdale, Flugrath, Kendalia, Hye, Twin Sisters, Old Tunnel State Park, Bankersmith and LBJ State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for south central Texas.
